text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen we're 
gonna do something a little different today and

i am going to answer fan mail i get questions all 
the time from hot thai kitchen fans all over the

world and today i've picked a few to share with 
you because you might have a similar question

let's get started the first question comes from 
Carolyn or Caroline and she asks in Thai cuisine

rice noodles flour and coconut milk seem to be 
used a lot however I rarely meet any Thai who

is obese what's the secret of Thai people staying 
slim and trim I get this question a lot actually

and first of all let me say that there are of 
course overweight Thai people but there are fewer

of us compared to say North America and I think 
there are many many different factors but there

are two that I think are significant first of all 
portion size if you've ever been to Thailand you

know that when you order food at a restaurant 
what you get is easily half the size or even

a third the size of something you would get in 
North America so the second reason I think has

to do with the way we eat in Thailand we eat 
family-style we share the meal with everyone

on the table so unlike in North America where 
you're presented with a plate that is yours to

finish in Thailand we just take a little bit from 
the middle and keep going and we stop when we're

full so we don't over eat just because it's there 
so those are I think two of the major reasons the

second question is from Isaac and he asks what is 
something that Thai people do that is completely

normal that foreigners will find strange there are 
actually many things that I could choose to answer

this question but I'll tell you one thing that I 
have personal experience with Thai people's eat

pizza with ketchup if you go to Thailand you go 
to Pizza Hut which is a nice sit-down restaurant

every table will have a bottle of ketchup so when 
I first came to Canada I went to Domino's and I

asked the guy at the counter for some ketchup so 
the guy looked at me like I was weird and he said

we don't have ketchup and so then I looked at 
him like he was weird thinking what do you mean

you don't have kids up you're a pieces of place 
thankfully I was with a Canadian friend who saved

me from myself and explain to me that loosing 
Thailand we don't eat ketchup with pizza here

like they don't do that and I was like oh okay 
and that was the first time I realized that eating

pizza with ketchup was a strictly Thai phenomenon 
maybe some other countries do it as well but if

you haven't tried that you should third question 
Lin is asking how and with what do you eat Thai

food chopsticks hands or fork the simple answer 
is fork and spoon okay about 90% of the times high

people eat with fork and a spoon and the way it 
works is the fork pushes the food onto the spoon

so that the spoon can hold all the sauces and the 
curries and everything and then this is what you

use to put in your mouth not before now we do use 
chopsticks okay not all the time but when we eat

noodles whether that's noodle soup or dry noodles 
a lot of people like to use chopsticks you don't

have to like I always use a fork and a spoon but 
a lot of people will and most noodle restaurants

will have chopsticks available and hence we do 
eat with our hands sometimes but only if we're

eating sticky rice because it's just near you can 
ball it up and then you can use the sticky rice

to soak up sauce and finally marry Kahn is asking 
almost everyone loves Thai food but what cuisine

do you think Thai people love to eat that's 
not their own mm-hmm so I actually asked all

my friends this just to make sure I'm on the same 
page just them so all my friends are in Thailand

they're all agreeing that Japanese food is the 
number one most popular ethnic food in at least

in Bangkok and second to that if I were to have 
to choose something would be Korean food which

is really up-and-coming in the past few years so a 
big thanks to all of you who submitted questions I

love answering your questions so please keep them 
coming and I will see you next time so at because
